dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form
Class SWTTreeTableController

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.AbstractWidgetController
      dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.AbstractMementoWidgetController
          dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTTreeTableController

public class SWTTreeTableController
extends AbstractMementoWidgetController

This class implements the controller for a SWTTreeTable.

The controller provides the access to the tree model. This default implementation works on mementos where each row in the tree is represented by a single memento that is addressed by index (not by id). The mementos form the structure of the tree beneath the getWidgetMemento().

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2009.a

doCanShowMemento

public boolean doCanShowMemento(java.lang.String mementoPath)
Checks if this controller is responsible for the given mementoId.

The default implementation returns true if the widgetMemento is on the same branch as the given memento.

Overrides:
doCanShowMemento in class AbstractMementoWidgetController
Parameters:
mementoPath - path to the memento to check (memento must exist)
Returns:
true if the widget is associated with the given mementoId, false otherwise
Since:
2009.a

doGetCellError

public boolean doGetCellError(java.lang.Object rowObject,
                              int column)
Query if the cell has an error marker.

Error markers are derrived from errors handed in by doUpdateValidationResults(List).

Parameters:
rowObject - The rowObject of the row to query
column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
Returns:
true if the cell has errors
Since:
2009.a

doGetRowIcon

public java.lang.String doGetRowIcon(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Get the icon that will be shown in the tree for the specified row.

The icon is resolved with AbstractPage.getImage(String).

This implementation expects a Memento as rowObject and returns the value of the attribute ATTRIBUTE_ROW_ICON.

Parameters:
rowObject - the parent row
Returns:
the icon path or null for no specific icon
Since:
2009.a

doIsRowEditable

public java.lang.Boolean doIsRowEditable(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Query if the given row is editable.

This default implementation queries the attribute ATTRIBUTE_ROW_EDITABLE and returns its value. If the attribute does not exist null is returned.

Parameters:
rowObject - the row ovject of the row to query
Returns:
Boolean( true ) if row should be editable, Boolean( false ) if row should not be editable, null for do not care
Since:
2009.a

doGetCellForeground

public org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color doGetCellForeground(java.lang.Object rowObject,

Get the foreground color of a cell.

The default implementation queries the attribute ATTRIBUTE_PREFIX_FGCOLOR + column memento-id.

Parameters:
rowObject - The rowObject of the row to query

Returns:
the color or null for default

doAddChildRow

public void doAddChildRow(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Adds a new row as last child of the given row by starting a coresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

This method is called when the add child button or curresponding operations are triggered from the GUI.

Parameters:
rowObject - parent object for the new row, may not be null
Since:
2009.a

doAddRow

public void doAddRow(java.lang.Object rowObject)
Adds a new row as last sibling of the given row by starting a coresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler. If the SWTTreeTable has no items or if no row is selected, the new row is added as toplevel element.

This method is called when the add button or curresponding operations are triggered from the GUI.

Parameters:
rowObject - sibling object for the new row, may be null.
Since:
2009.a

doInsertRow

public void doInsertRow(java.lang.Object rowObject,
                        int row)
Inserts a new row at the given row of the table by starting a coresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

This operation is currently unused and calls doAddChildRow(java.lang.Object).

Parameters:
rowObject - parent object
row - The position at which to add the new one
Since:
2009.a

doDuplicateRows

public void doDuplicateRows(java.lang.Object[] rowObjects,
                            int toRow)
Duplicates the given rows and adds the newly created at the position given by toRow by issuing the corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

The method is called when the duplicate button is pressed in the toolbar of the tree.

Parameters:
rowObjects - The row objects to copy
toRow - the row to add at the same leven where the new element should be added (currently unused, rows are added at the end!)
Since:
2009.a

doRemoveRows

public void doRemoveRows(java.lang.Object[] rowObjects)
Removes the given rows from the table by issuing the corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

This method is called when the delete button is pressed in the GUI.

Parameters:
rowObjects - The rows to remove
Since:
2009.a

doSetCellValue

public void doSetCellValue(java.lang.Object rowObject,
                           int column,
                           java.lang.String value)
Changes the value of a cell by issuing a corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

This method is called when the value of a cell is edited in the table.

This operation only works if the given row already exists.

Parameters:
rowObject - The row object of the cell that is been changed
column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
value - the new value
Since:
2009.a

getColumnMementoPaths

protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getColumnMementoPaths()
Get the mementos of the columns as defined with SWTColumnDescription.getMementoId().

This method does not return a path to the index column so the first entry is the pat to the memento after the index column.

Returns:
Paths relative to the row memento that point to the column memento attributes
Since:
2009.a

getColumnDescription

protected SWTColumnDescription getColumnDescription(int column)
Fetch the column description for the given column from the SWTTable.

Parameters:
column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
Returns:
The SWTColumnDescription of the column or null if column is out of bounds
Since:
2009.a

getCellPath

public java.lang.String getCellPath(Memento rowMemento,
                                    int column)
Get the memento path to the given cell.

The cell does not need to exist.

Parameters:
rowMemento - The memento of the row
column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
Returns:
the path to the cell
Since:
2009.a
